project.projectDescription: This dataset was built with the purpose of helping students in shortlisting universities with their profiles. The predicted output gives them a fair idea about their chances for a particular university. What is the most important element in application for a Master Program?
project.dataDescription: The dataset contains several parameters which are considered important during the application for Masters Programs. The parameters included are : 1. GRE Scores ( out of 340 ) 2. TOEFL Scores ( out of 120 ) 3. University Rating ( out of 5 ) 4. Statement of Purpose and Letter of Recommendation Strength ( out of 5 ) 5. Undergraduate GPA ( out of 10 ) 6. Research Experience ( either 0 or 1 ) 7. Chance of Admit ( ranging from 0 to 1 ) For my project, I will focus on the attribute 1, 2, 3 and 5.
project.researchQuestion: With the alpha = 0.05 level, will there be a multiple linear regression relationship between GRE, TOEFL, University Rank and Undergraduate GPA to the Admit Chance?
project.conclusion: According to the multiple linear regression model, we got a very small p-value which means there are strong evidence that there is a strong linear relationship between the selected attributes and the admit chance at the alpha = 0.05 level. And according to the coefficients, Undergraduate GPA is the most important element for enrollment to a Master Program. As the GPA increased 1, there is 13.3% chance of admit increased.
